text:
Hii Karis :slightly_smiling_face:
you want to edit your email footer. I think this link will help you.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/email/can-i-customize-my-can-spam-email-footer>.

So i put some images in a drag and drop email and when i either try to view a test email in outlook or just use a shareable preview URL, the images aren't displaying. When I go to inspect it, there is a display: none !important coming from an "injected stylesheet". Does anyone know what that means?

Edit: Figured it out - turns out it was my adblocker extension
OMG <@UDFSF3N1F> I spent hours one day with that problem!!! lol
was the image in a CTA?
No, it was just a regular image using the image module
and I should have said this at first too, but the word "ad" was used in the URL and alt text of the image (since the email is about using Google ads), which I assume is an obvious flag for Adblocker

hello~im so confused as to why this shows up in outlook. why does the border show up like this? i have the 'do not add border around the email' selected. yet in outlook, this grey line keeps showing up. anyone experiencing it too? how did u solve it?
